description: Program to facilitate analyses fitting a linear, mixed model via restricted maximum likelihood (REML).
name: Wombat

metadata.abstract: WOMBAT is a software package for quantitative genetic analyses of continuous traits, fitting a linear, mixed model; estimates of covariance components and the resulting genetic parameters are obtained by restricted maximum likelihood. A wide range of models, comprising numerous traits, multiple fixed and random effects, selected genetic covariance structures, random regression models and reduced rank estimation are accommodated. WOMBAT employs up-to-date numerical and computational methods. Together with the use of efficient compilers, this generates fast executable programs, suitable for large scale analyses. Use of WOMBAT is illustrated for a bivariate analysis. The package consists of the executable program, available for LINUX and WINDOWS environments, manual and a set of worked example, and can be downloaded free of charge from (http://agbu. une.edu.au/~kmeyer/wombat.html).
metadata.journal: Journal of Zhejiang University. Science. B.
metadata.title: WOMBAT: a tool for mixed model analyses in quantitative genetics by restricted maximum likelihood (REML).
